title: Drawing, "Design for a Bowl", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, yellow color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower right: J.P./36/ø
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Round flared bowl drawn in plan and elevation raised on a circular base with an applied ring indicated in yellow color pencil, probably to be executed in vermeil. Base decorated with applied rectangular panels on four sides overlapping onto the ring. Underdrawing in graphite of bowl in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains archival photograph of bowl sitting in a square wood base, Box 7, Folder 19, "Cups, 9000 series," # 9118.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 9118, Coupe pied gros jones avec 8 appliques
